channel.title: Rundll.exe?
channel.description:
So i decided to search task manager, and i found a file in taskmanager running called "rundll32.exe" is this a bad sign?
Its only 44kb..
Should i delete? When i tried it was in system32 and i thought if i delete this and its not a virus im fked!
So i wanted to ask you guys..

item.title: Rundll.exe?
item.dc:creator: @whattehp406 whattehp406
item.description:
@whattehp406 wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:9, topic:386379”][quote author=Saphire` link=topic=482134.msg3532398#msg3532398 date=1300278044]
IT just initialises DLL files to be read by the CPU and processed.
[/quote]
Why would they keep running after the dll files are initialized though?[/quote]for quick rerunning

Read full topic

item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Saphire`:

IT just initialises DLL files to be read by the CPU and processed.

Why would they keep running after the dll files are initialized though?

item.title: Rundll.exe?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I believe it does exactly as the name implies, it runs dll’s. What you should worry about is whether the dll it is running is malicious or not.

Read full topic

item.title: Rundll.exe?
item.dc:creator: @drubrkletern drubrkletern
item.description:
@drubrkletern wrote:

Oh thank goodness

But just wondering, what exactly does it do?

I saw “rundll.exe” as dangerous on mendorphins keylogger warning sticky, and i panicked.

Read full topic

item.title: Rundll.exe?
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

This is actually a very common (as it is a windows thing) task in windows. I, sometimes, can end up with around 10 running at the same time. It’s nothing to be worried about.

Read full topic
